name: domestically
content:
domestically adverb
(COUNTRY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
inside a particular country rather than in other countries: Such a policy would be unacceptable both domestically and internationally. The movie made $76 million domestically but only $1.3 million abroad.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bill limits sugar imports in order to support the price of domestically produced sugar.The film is being distributed domestically by Fox and overseas by Miramax. Voters are afraid that their jobs could be "outsourced" to countries where wages are a fraction of what they are domestically.

domestically adverb
(HOME)
in a way that relates to someone's home, house, or family: I've never been so happy romantically and domestically. Related word
domestic
More examplesFewer examplesThe next day, the rubbish had gone, the garage was swept, I’d mowed the lawn, and I was feeling domestically quite proud.The media tries to make us believe that all women are domestically orientated.

domestically adverb
(HOME)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the home, house, or family: domestically oriented advertising
domestically adverb
(COUNTRY)
in a way that relates to a person's own country: The movie took in $77.9 million domestically, but only made $9.1 million overseas.
